This should be made easy to do, imho, but I cannot find out how to do this. _______ _______ UPDATE: I have since had an email from a developer and can confirm that I am now able to extract the data I wanted. On a HP20 Pro this can be done by: 1) Go to Settings 2) Choose Google 3) Click on COVID-19 Support (Exposure Notifications) 4) Click on "Exposure Checks" 5) Click on the 3 dots in top-right corner and choose "Export exposure checks" This will output in JSON format (I chose to email it to myself for ease-of-access). Import into something like Excel and parse data. This enabled me to see how many checks had been done, and to confirm that the matchesCount was zero. I hope that is of some help to any others wanting to find out how to do the same thing.
replyContent:
Hello, the NHS COVID-19 app does not hold any information which could directly identify you. For example, your name, address, or date of birth. It uses the postcode district . It will not provide the precise location where you live. To manage your data follow these steps from the app home screen:
1.    About this app
2.    Manage my data
